title: GET_PED_PROP_GLOBAL_INDEX_FROM_COLLECTION
content:
0x2CB45CDC// GetPedPropGlobalIndexFromCollection
int GET_PED_PROP_GLOBAL_INDEX_FROM_COLLECTION(Ped ped, int anchorPoint, char* collection, int propIndex);Parameters:ped: The target pedanchorPoint: One of the anchor points from SET_PED_PROP_INDEXcollection: Name of the collection. Empty string for the base game collection. See GET_PED_COLLECTION_NAME in order to list all available collections.propIndex: Local prop index inside the given collection. Refer to GET_NUMBER_OF_PED_COLLECTION_PROP_DRAWABLE_VARIATIONS.Returns: Global prop index that corresponds to the given collection and local prop index. Returns -1 if Ped or collection does not exist or local index is out of bounds.Returns global prop index based on the local one. Is it a reverse to GET_PED_COLLECTION_NAME_FROM_PROP and GET_PED_COLLECTION_LOCAL_INDEX_FROM_PROP natives.Props are stored inside collections. Each collection usually corresponds to a certain DCL or the base game.If all props from all collections are placed into one continuous array - the global index will correspond to the index of the prop in such array. Local index is index of the prop in this array relative to the start of the given collection.
codeBlocks:
// GetPedPropGlobalIndexFromCollection
int GET_PED_PROP_GLOBAL_INDEX_FROM_COLLECTION(Ped ped, int anchorPoint, char* collection, int propIndex);

local ped = PlayerPedId()
-- Example usage for GET_PED_PROP_GLOBAL_INDEX_FROM_COLLECTION
GetPedPropGlobalIndexFromCollection(ped, 0, '', 0)
